revised_title: Ferroverdin: Structure and Production of a Green Iron-Containing Pigment
tldr: The authors studied a green iron-containing pigment called ferroverdin produced by a Streptomyces species. They determined the optimum culture conditions for pigmentation and analyzed the structure of ferroverdin and its degradation products. The study suggests that ferroverdin is the ferrous complex of the p-vinylphenylester of 3-nitroso-4-hydroxybenzoic acid.
